definition: to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: But after ru-song li river in hanyang paju there is still no offense.
sentences.chinese: 但是李如松過江後駐守坡州仍然沒有進攻漢陽。

sentences.english: There was a US base here until just two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 直到兩年前，冰島還有一個美軍基地駐守。

sentences.english: He bade them to allow not her waters to escape.
sentences.chinese: 他命令她們駐守，以防她體內的水流洶湧而出。

sentences.english: There are now about 147, 000 U.S. troops in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 目前約有14萬7千名美軍駐守伊拉克。

sentences.english: The town was garrisoned by a battalion .
In addition to clearing structures Buzzers can also garrison them.
sentences.chinese: 此外，蜂羣清除建築物後可以駐守在裏面。

sentences.english: And meanwhile, they fortified the place and stationed army there to strengthen their military control.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時還設置砦堡和駐守義軍土兵，加強軍事控制。

sentences.english: The soldier has been garrisoned at the radar station for more than three years.
sentences.chinese: 這位戰士駐守在這個雷達站已經有三年的時間了。

sentences.english: South Korean tourist groups no longer travel across the heavily armed inter-Korean border.
sentences.chinese: 韓國旅行團此後不曾越過重兵駐守的朝韓邊境。

sentences.english: Use a black hand to clear out garrisons , and then take it for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 用黑手清掉駐守的步兵，然後自己佔一個地堡。

sentences.english: Max Wünsche's panzers were holding the eastern edges of the Hill 112 feature.
sentences.chinese: 馬克斯威施的裝甲部隊在東部的112高地駐守。

sentences.english: A public outcry in Thailand caused both governments to send troops to the area.
sentences.chinese: 由於泰國民情激憤，兩國政府都派兵駐守該地區。

sentences.english: The soldiers at the border halted the travelers to check their passports.
sentences.chinese: 駐守邊界的士兵把遊客攔下來，檢查他們的護照。

sentences.english: There you will find an entrance that is girdled with sea anemones.
sentences.chinese: 那裏你將會發現一個由海葵駐守的入口。

sentences.english: The government will garrison the coastal towns.
sentences.chinese: 政府將派軍駐守沿海城鎮。

sentences.english: Use a Black Hand to clear out garrisons , and then take it for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 用黑手清掉駐守得步兵，然後自己佔一個地堡。

definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
